result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Email confirmation for 11/7 at 9 w/Redgranite
Information tracking complaint and Deft. waives reading and enters a NOT GUILTY Plea to all Counts.

1:11 PM Defendant Tracy Raymond Sullivan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Tracy Raymond Sullivan.  Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Spansail does not have PQW for which was mailed to Deft.  Deft. mailed the form back but no rec'd. yet.  PQW  that Deft. rec'd in mail is reviewed by Court. Court finds waiver to be made freely and voluntarily. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed by this defendant and is bound over to the circuit court. Present bond cont'd.   Next hearing by Video.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
